publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1164.1 John Park: Trade Union Democracy—As an amendment to motion (S3M-1164) in the name of John Wilson, leave out from "expresses" to end and insert "recognises that trade unions play a vital role in representing members’ views in the workplace and wider society; further recognises that trade union members are required by law to participate in political fund ballots every 10 years; supports the wholly democratic structures of trade unions which enable members biannually to determine all areas of policy, including which political parties should receive political donations; promotes increased membership activity within trade unions, and encourages all mainstream political parties to engage with trade unions as social partners in an effective and constructive manner." Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-1164.1 Trade Union Democracy (lodged on 22 January 2008) Hugh Henry*, Tom McCabe*

S3M-1164.1 John Park: Trade Union Democracy—As an amendment to motion (S3M-1164) in the name of John Wilson, leave out from "expresses" to end and insert "recognises that trade unions play a vital role in representing members’ views in the workplace and wider society; further recognises that trade union members are required by law to participate in political fund ballots every 10 years; supports the wholly democratic structures of trade unions which enable members biannually to determine all areas of policy, including which political parties should receive political donations; promotes increased membership activity within trade unions, and encourages all mainstream political parties to engage with trade unions as social partners in an effective and constructive manner." Supported by: Elaine Murray, Cathy Peattie, Karen Gillon, James Kelly, Claire Baker, Andy Kerr, Rhona Brankin, Marlyn Glen, Cathy Jamieson, Des McNulty, Charlie Gordon, Michael McMahon, Bill Butler, Helen Eadie, Iain Gray, Jackie Baillie, Paul Martin, Ken Macintosh, Sarah Boyack, Lewis Macdonald, Mary Mulligan, Richard Baker, David Whitton, Mr Frank McAveety, Trish Godman, Patricia Ferguson, Marilyn Livingstone, George Foulkes, Dr Richard Simpson, Hugh Henry, Tom McCabe, Elaine Smith*
